<p>If you’re looking to grab a new SSD for a PC,<a data-i13n="cpos:1;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/gaming/playstation/best-ssd-for-ps5-130004175.html"> <ins>PS5</ins></a>,<a data-i13n="cpos:2;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/gaming/best-handheld-gaming-system-140018863.html"> <ins>gaming handheld</ins></a> or any other gadget, <a data-i13n="cpos:3;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/deals/the-best-black-friday-deals-on-tech-for-2025-get-up-to-50-percent-off-gear-from-apple-amazon-disney-lego-dyson-and-others-230008015.html">Black Friday</a> is typically a good time to take the plunge. To help you separate the fake discounts from the stuff worth your time, we’ve picked through the many sales going on now and rounded up the best Black Friday SSD deals and other storage discounts we could find below. So far we’ve got a handful of discounts on well-reviewed<a data-i13n="cpos:4;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-ssds-140014262.html"> <ins>internal drives</ins></a>,<a data-i13n="cpos:5;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-portable-ssd-120043652.html"> <ins>portable SSDs</ins></a> and<a data-i13n="cpos:6;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/computing/accessories/best-microsd-card-130038282.html"> <ins>microSD cards</ins></a>, but we&#39;ll update this post as we find more offers that are worth calling out.</p> 
<h2 id="jump-link-best-black-friday-microsd-card-deals">Best Black Friday microSD card deals</h2> 
<p>

<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Best Buy;elmt:;cpos:7;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Best+Buy&amp;linkText=Samsung+Pro+Plus+%281TB%2C+2-pack%29+for+%24136+at+Best+Buy+%28%24104+off+MSRP%29&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAfDOQIcS1DL1j0uC0PbYNr2AA5eKhnMa3wf8V7zOOTqp&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Fsamsung-pro-plus-1-tb-microsdxc-memory-card%2FJ3ZYG2H8KR%2Fsku%2F6588058" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.bestbuy.com/product/samsung-pro-plus-1-tb-microsdxc-memory-card/J3ZYG2H8KR/sku/6588058"><strong>Samsung Pro Plus (1TB, 2-pack) for $136 at Best Buy ($104 off MSRP)</strong></a>: The Pro Plus is the runner-up pick in our guide to the best microSD cards. On its own, it’s not worth buying over the faster <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:8;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0DG4GJ736&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=Lexar+Professional+Silver+Plus&amp;custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwREc0R0o3MzY_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiMzM0MGM2ZTktNGY5Ny00ZTcyLTk2NGQtMzhhMGNlNGNmYjMwIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwREc0R0o3MzYiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&amp;signature=AQAAAb0yz7rAiCbP0zXeQ1KhCF04bLr7kfrCtkv-9uhA6oDv&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0DG4GJ736" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DG4GJ736?th=1">Lexar Professional Silver Plus</a> when both are available for the same price — which is the case right now — but this bundle deal that packages two 1TB cards together for $68 apiece is much more appealing if you need space for multiple devices. Just add two to your cart or click the “special offers” link on Best Buy’s product page to see the discount at checkout. If you need another card, you can also grab a three-pack for $204. For reference, the previous low for an individual 1TB Pro Plus card is $70.</p> <span id="end-legacy-contents"></span>
<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:9;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0DYB7ZGR3&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=Lexar+Play+Pro+%28256GB%29+microSD+Express+card+for+%2449+at+Amazon+%28%2411+off%29&amp;custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRFlCN1pHUjM_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiMzM0MGM2ZTktNGY5Ny00ZTcyLTk2NGQtMzhhMGNlNGNmYjMwIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRFlCN1pHUjMiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&amp;signature=AQAAAaOfI-1EeOdW11rG3nwfXhcPlBjQLo-unWQE_GuvtCAe&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0DYB7ZGR3" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DYB7ZGR3?th=1"><strong>Lexar Play Pro (256GB) microSD Express card for $49 at Amazon ($11 off)</strong></a>: The only reason to buy a super-fast (but pricey) microSD Express card is to expand the storage of a <a data-i13n="cpos:10;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/switch-2/">Nintendo Switch 2</a>, which requires the newer format. In our guide to the <a data-i13n="cpos:11;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/gaming/nintendo/best-microsd-cards-for-nintendo-switch-2-160052947.html">best Switch 2 microSD cards</a>, we found each model we tested to perform similarly in actual games, so your best bet is to buy whichever one you can find in stock at the lowest price. Nintendo has <a data-i13n="cpos:12;pos:1" href="https://www.nintendo.com/us/whatsnew/nintendo-announces-holiday-offers-for-black-friday-and-cyber-monday-2025/">already announced</a> that <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:13;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0F3VTCZK8&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=Samsung%E2%80%99s+256GB+Express+card&amp;custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRjNWVENaSzg_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiMzM0MGM2ZTktNGY5Ny00ZTcyLTk2NGQtMzhhMGNlNGNmYjMwIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRjNWVENaSzgiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&amp;signature=AQAAAWKkzIxOcS--uv4Gg2aPR2CjD4B4kOOcvzpjDgoN1l2K&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0F3VTCZK8" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0F3VTCZK8">Samsung’s 256GB Express card</a> will be available for “$20 off MSRP” on November 30, which should bring it down to $40.&nbsp;</p> 
<p>If you can wait to pounce on that offer, you should. But if you can’t for some reason, or if that discount quickly sells out, this is only $2 more than the best price we’ve seen for Lexar’s equivalent model. The <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:14;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0DYB9TNB4&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=1TB+version&amp;custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRFlCOVROQjQ_dGFnPWdkZ3QwYy0yMCIsImNvbnRlbnRVdWlkIjoiMzM0MGM2ZTktNGY5Ny00ZTcyLTk2NGQtMzhhMGNlNGNmYjMwIiwib3JpZ2luYWxVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2RwL0IwRFlCOVROQjQiLCJkeW5hbWljQ2VudHJhbFRyYWNraW5nSWQiOnRydWUsInNpdGVJZCI6InVzLWVuZ2FkZ2V0IiwicGFnZUlkIjoiMXAtYXV0b2xpbmsiLCJmZWF0dXJlSWQiOiJ0ZXh0LWxpbmsifQ&amp;signature=AQAAAcmFSwxl6mZKKi610fa2sJmPB8ROf5MstvyG6LZOHzv8&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fdp%2FB0DYB9TNB4" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0DYB9TNB4?th=1">1TB version</a> is also worth noting at $186; that&#39;s not an all-time low, but it&#39;s the best price we can find for a microSD Express card with that much capacity right now.</p>

<h2 id="jump-link-best-black-friday-internal-ssd-deals">Best Black Friday internal SSD deals</h2> 
<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Newegg;elmt:;cpos:17;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=6ce976db-26d7-4094-a1be-4d1496b213f0&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Newegg&amp;linkText=SK+Hynix+Platinum+P51+%281TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+for+%24110+at+Newegg+%28%2460+off%29&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAATWhXORbD5kjoJ7Qht8OLOA4WadclPYdccJGlpNzRBel&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newegg.com%2Fsk-hynix-1tb-nvme%2Fp%2FN82E16820329025" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.newegg.com/sk-hynix-1tb-nvme/p/N82E16820329025"><strong>SK Hynix Platinum P51 (1TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD for $110 at Newegg ($60 off)</strong></a>: Most people don’t have to pay extra for the top-tier performance of a PCIe 5.0 SSD like the Platinum P51, but if you need something for more intense workloads or just want the comfort of owning a more futureproof SSD, <a data-i13n="cpos:18;pos:1" href="https://www.storagereview.com/review/sk-hynix-platinum-p51-review-balanced-performance-for-demanding-workloads">reviews</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:19;pos:1" href="https://www.techpowerup.com/review/sk-hynix-p51-platinum-2-tb/">around</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:20;pos:1" href="https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/sk-hynix-platinum-p51">the web</a> suggest this is one of the better options available. Just make sure you have a compatible motherboard and CPU first. This offer ties the lowest price yet for the 1TB model. Use the code <strong>BFEFE96 </strong>to get the full discount at checkout.</p>

This discount comes within $10 of the 2TB version’s all-time low.&nbsp;</p> 
<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:B&amp;H Photo;elmt:;cpos:25;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=B%26H+Photo&amp;linkText=Crucial+T710+%282TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+with+heatsink+for+%24190+at+B%26H+%28%24130+off%29&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAYsEyUvj9m07rbWy7PkXBcddj16vzeJZ-Tho4MaySNdM&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1901049-REG%2Fcrucial_ct2000t710ssd5_2tb_t710_nvme_pcie.html" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1901049-REG/crucial_ct2000t710ssd5_2tb_t710_nvme_pcie.html"><strong>Crucial T710 (2TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD with heatsink for $190 at B&amp;H ($130 off)</strong></a>: The T710 is Crucial’s successor to the T705. Most <a data-i13n="cpos:26;pos:1" href="https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/crucial-t710-2tb-ssd-review">reviews</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:27;pos:1" href="https://www.pcmag.com/reviews/crucial-t710">suggest</a> it isn’t a massive leap over the older version in real-world performance, but it’s generally quicker, and it’s a more noticeable improvement in terms of power efficiency. If you’re willing to spend a little bit extra, this is the best price we&#39;ve tracked for the 2TB model with a heatsink, which isn&#39;t 100 percent essential for everyone but helps minimize thermal throttling all the same. It’s usually retailed for $250 in recent months. Also at <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Best Buy;elmt:;cpos:28;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=5e0bed65-d2f8-4b34-9b8f-955218c0e37a&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Best+Buy&amp;linkText=Best+Buy&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAXEbW1m6HIcWumFgwE0qWkB1Ak2A1al-4kT0MMk2r5D-&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fproduct%2Fcrucial-t710-2tb-internal-ssd-pcie-gen-5-x4-nvme-m-2-with-heatsink%2FJX8PSKC94V%2Fsku%2F6636637" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.bestbuy.com/product/crucial-t710-2tb-internal-ssd-pcie-gen-5-x4-nvme-m-2-with-heatsink/JX8PSKC94V/sku/6636637">Best Buy</a>.</p> 
<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:B&amp;H Photo;elmt:;cpos:29;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=B%26H+Photo&amp;linkText=Samsung+SSD+9100+Pro+%288TB%29+PCIe+5.0+SSD+with+heatsink+for+%24750+at+B%26H+%28%24270+off%29&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAQsTNZhu3_x2edyre-TFeRE-Fi4fgIAik2XMJ98F41od&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1878205-REG%2Fsamsung_mz_vap8t0cw_8tb_9100_pro_pcie.html" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1878205-REG/samsung_mz_vap8t0cw_8tb_9100_pro_pcie.html"><strong>Samsung SSD 9100 Pro (8TB) PCIe 5.0 SSD with heatsink for $750 at B&amp;H ($270 off)</strong></a>: Yes, we realize this is a ton to spend on a new SSD, but if you’re in the niche that wants a PCIe 5.0 drive with as much capacity as possible, it ties the lowest price we’ve tracked for the 8TB variant of Samsung’s top-end model. Most <a data-i13n="cpos:30;pos:1" href="https://www.techpowerup.com/review/wd-black-sn8100-2-tb/">reviews</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:31;pos:1" href="https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/sandisk-wd-black-sn8100-2tb-ssd-review">say</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:32;pos:1" href="https://www.pcgamesn.com/wd/black-sn8100-review">that</a> the 9100 Pro is outpaced by the <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:33;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=WD+Black+SN8100&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAb0QLpFKmbgOxY36GOfmY2AdQFKA0LJ1kCdhiaol3QY0&amp;gcReferrer=http%3A%2F%2Famazon.com%2FWD_BLACK-SN8100-Internal-Solid-State%2Fdp%2FB0F3BMBQ75" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="http://amazon.com/WD_BLACK-SN8100-Internal-Solid-State/dp/B0F3BMBQ75">WD Black SN8100</a> at the enthusiast end of the market, but it’s still competitive, and the <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:SanDisk;elmt:;cpos:34;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=f45797c5-bae4-4ba9-9419-9454e07b099d&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=SanDisk&amp;linkText=8TB+version&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAZbTErgIt2ctcCqCr16aEm5XUerk7cpYEJ3Kkr9klx2s&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.sandisk.com%2Fproducts%2Fssd%2Finternal-ssd%2Fwd-black-sn8100-ssd%3Fsku%3DWDS800T1X0M-00CMT0" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://shop.sandisk.com/products/ssd/internal-ssd/wd-black-sn8100-ssd?sku=WDS800T1X0M-00CMT0">8TB version</a> of that WD drive is priced $250 higher as of this writing. Most other direct rivals, meanwhile, aren’t yet available with this much space.&nbsp;</p> 
<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:35;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0D61SDZD2&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=Crucial+P310+%282TB%29+M.2+2230+SSD+for+%24130+at+Amazon+%28%24111+off%29&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAASxKv0XtQHCvC3eMa_ZX_LK6Q6Y2b0D5DHUfYAhuDktz&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FCrucial-2024-P310-PCIe-Gen4%2Fdp%2FB0D61SDZD2%2F" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/Crucial-2024-P310-PCIe-Gen4/dp/B0D61SDZD2/"><strong>Crucial P310 (2TB) M.2 2230 SSD for $130 at Amazon ($111 off)</strong></a>: The P310 is a small-size SSD you can slot in certain thin and light notebooks or gaming handhelds like the <a data-i13n="cpos:36;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/steam-deck-oled-review-its-just-better-180038030.html">Steam Deck</a>. It uses cheaper QLC memory, not the faster and more durable TLC, but <a data-i13n="cpos:37;pos:1" href="https://www.tweaktown.com/reviews/10790/crucial-p310-2tb-handheld-gaming-ssd-when-qlc-beats-tlc/index.html">most</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:38;pos:1" href="https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/ssds/crucial-p310-ssd-review">reviews</a> <a data-i13n="cpos:39;pos:1" href="https://www.pcworld.com/article/2379686/crucial-p310-nvme-ssd-review.html">say</a> it performs well for what it is. This discount is a few bucks above the largest drop to date for the 2TB model, but it’s still about $20 off the drive’s usual street price. Also at <a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:B&amp;H Photo;elmt:;cpos:40;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=95276f3c-7b79-4c1e-803f-981cd9f7a968&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=B%26H+Photo&amp;linkText=B%26H&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAXfn1qi1WyU5PxPR3WnOFC4f6yCk8P7alPJQalok-vdw&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bhphotovideo.com%2Fc%2Fproduct%2F1835939-REG%2Fcrucial_ct2000p310ssd2_p310_2tb_pcie_gen4.html" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1835939-REG/crucial_ct2000p310ssd2_p310_2tb_pcie_gen4.html">B&amp;H</a>.</p> 
<h2 id="jump-link-best-black-friday-portable-ssd-deals">Best Black Friday portable SSD deals</h2> 
<p>

<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:41;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B09BJYXMDW&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=3340c6e9-4f97-4e72-964d-38a0ce4cfb30&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=Seagate+Storage+Expansion+Card+for+Xbox+%282TB%29+for+%24200+at+Amazon+%28%2430+off%29&amp;custData=eyJzb3VyY2VOYW1lIjoiV2ViLURlc2t0b3AtVmVyaXpvbiIsImxhbmRpbmdVcmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5hbWF6b24uY29tL2dwL3Byb2R1Y3QvQjA5QkpZWE1EVy9yZWY9b3hfc2NfYWN0X3RpdGxlXzE_&amp;signature=AQAAARlZ5nds0zvOHa95My0eGSl8CXkF7oZE0SQ4NChXhBpj&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fproduct%2FB09BJYXMDW%2Fref%3Dox_sc_act_title_1" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B09BJYXMDW/ref=ox_sc_act_title_1?smid=ATVPDKIKX0DER&amp;th=1"><strong>Seagate Storage Expansion Card for Xbox (2TB) for $200 at Amazon ($30 off)</strong></a>: Annoying as it is, the only way to <a data-i13n="cpos:42;pos:1" href="https://support.xbox.com/en-US/help/hardware-network/storage/manage-storage">fully add storage</a> to an Xbox Series X or Series S is to use a proprietary expansion card. Only two of those exist, and they’re both expensive compared to traditional SSDs. Still, they’re dead simple to set up, and this Seagate model holds up well compared to the consoles’ internal storage. While this deal for the 2TB version isn’t an all-time low, it’s about $20 off the card’s usual going rate over the last few months.
